comment.author: 61849735@N00
comment._content: Interesting caption.  wonder what the story is.

comment.author: 99646216@N00
comment._content: It didn't end well, anyway... New York Times archives: THREE PLOTTERS EXECUTED.; El Paso Prisoners Reveal Details of Felix Diaz Conspiracy. April 12, 1916, Wednesday EL PASO, Texas, April 11. -- Three leaders of the Diaz plot to seize Juarez and overthrow the Carranza garrison there last Sunday, were executed by the firing squad in Juarez early today. They were Nicholas Chavazarria. Jose Inez Bornel, and Florencio Hernandez. The condemned men confirmed the charge of the plot. Other Mexicans were implicated. Full article is on PDF here if you're interested: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?_r=1&res=9503E... I do love the internet.

comment._content: That's not a French horn; most likely a tuba.

comment.author: 53461717@N08
comment._content: These peons worked in Felix Diaz's estate and became owners of a fraction of the 73,000 acres Diaz owned. Those fractions (now called "ejdido") were bestowed by Lucio Blanco on september 11, 1913. So the picture is part of the series "Blanco giving land to peons" in this Bain Collection [call nr LC-B2-2834-14] www.loc.gov/pictures/resource/ggbain.14332/. Dr. Roberto Duarte
